intro: Cephalaria procera, commonly known as the tall cephalaria, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, featuring hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow with a distinctive central disc, blooming from late spring to early autumn. Cephalaria procera is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to full sun conditions.
